identificationModule.briefTitle: Values-Affirmation + Education Intervention Targeting Medication Adherence in Older Adults With Heart Failure
identificationModule.officialTitle: Pilot Randomized Controlled Trial of a Values-Affirmation Intervention Targeting Medication Adherence in Older Adults With Heart Failure

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The goals of this study are to determine the (1) feasibility and (2) acceptability of the study procedures through a pilot randomized controlled trial of a values affirmation intervention targeting medication adherence in adults with heart failure enrolled in cardiac rehabilitation relative to usual care.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
Heart failure (HF) represents a significant public health concern. Medication non-adherence is a modifiable contributor to costly hospital readmissions in older adults with HF. Educational interventions improve, but do not eliminate, non-adherence. Values affirmation interventions which invite individuals to reflect on core values may encourage better engagement in health behaviors by increasing the personal relevance of targeted behaviors. This study tests a values-affirmation intervention targeting medication adherence in older adults with HF enrolled in cardiac rehabilitation.

The objective of this study is to examine the feasibility and acceptability of study procedures and the values-affirmation intervention in a pilot randomized controlled trial. Participants will complete a baseline assessment including 30 days of medication monitoring using electronic medication monitoring devices. After the baseline medication monitoring period, participants will be randomly assigned to either the intervention or control condition. Intervention participants will be asked to complete a brief intervention with tailored education relevant to medication information, motivation, and behavioral skills in additional to their usual cardiac rehabilitation care. Control participants will continue with their usual care. Participants will be asked to continue using the medication monitoring devices and to complete a final assessment 30 days later.

interventions.name: Values Affirmation + Usual Care
interventions.description: Participants will engage in a brief values-affirmation exercise to target personal motivation and openness to medication adherence. The interventionist will then review tailored medication education and individual skills training recommendations. The participant's study medication monitoring devices will be labeled with the participants' most important core value(s). Participants will also continue with their usual care.

interventions.name: Usual Care
interventions.description: Participants will be asked to continue with their usual care (e.g., cardiac rehabilitation, ongoing medical management)

primaryOutcomes.description: Proportion of eligible participants who enroll in the study, Proportion of enrolled participants who complete the study.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Acceptability of intervention and study procedures
primaryOutcomes.description: Participant self-reported satisfaction with intervention content and delivery \[intervention group only\] and study procedures

secondaryOutcomes.description: Medication adherence will be electronically monitored. Adherence will be calculated as the overall percentage of prescribed doses taken during the monitoring period (30 days for baseline, 30 days once the intervention is initiated)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline (30 days of monitoring), post-test (30 days of monitoring)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Self-reported medication adherence will be assessed using a 7-day timeline follow-back procedure.
Pill counts will be conducted on one medication

otherOutcomes.measure: Change in Information, Motivation, and -Behavioral Skills related to HF medication management
otherOutcomes.description: A self-report questionnaire adapted for use in HF to assess HF medication knowledge, related motivation, and behavioral skills

otherOutcomes.measure: Change in Positive and Negative Affect
otherOutcomes.description: Positive and Negative Affect Scale-Short Form
Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) Self-Efficacy for Managing Chronic Conditions- Managing Medications and Treatment-Short Form 4a

otherOutcomes.measure: Change in Disease-related Quality of Life
otherOutcomes.description: Minnesota Living with Heart Failure Questionnaire

otherOutcomes.measure: Change in General Quality of Life

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Heart failure
* Enrolled in cardiac rehabilitation
* Read and understand English

Exclusion Criteria:

* Current participation in another medication-monitoring clinical or research protocol
* New York Heart Association class IV heart failure
* Diagnosis of Alzheimer's, dementia, or severe cognitive impairment indicated on screening
* Current suicidality or psychosis
